course.subject: COMP
course.name: Principles of Database Design
course.description: Data modeling concepts; conceptual, logical and physical design; analyzing, evaluating and improving schemas; schema documentation and maintenance; functional analysis; design tools; schema mappings; database tuning; distributed database design.

reviews.author: hautonjt
reviews.title: (database_enjoyment == "high") ? take_course : do_not_take
reviews.comment_content: Honestly, it cannot be said that the content is bad. However, it is also certainly not amazing. There is a lot to be learned, but most of what is learned is also quite useless and not tested. The course covered conceptual modeling, schema integration, calculating costs of replicating databases, data warehouse schemas, navigational schemas, normalization, etc. There is a whole lot of content, and each chapter has ~100 slides, but you can get away with not actually knowing the material that well. One interesting aspect is that a lot of the content, such as navigational schemas, cannot be found through Google, and is not in the textbook. Did the professor make it up or something? I have no clue.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Kenneth is quite an enthusiastic teacher, and attempts to construct a bit of class participation by blanking out key words in the slides so that students actually need to attend the class to find out what those words are. He explains concepts pretty well, and uses the whiteboard a bit, which I enjoy. He also gives out in-class exercises as a way of taking attendance during lectures. These are graded for completion.

Oh, and the TA is a joke. By that I mean I have no idea what he says because his English is just awful. His handwriting is not very good and he frequently misspells words in ways that are really funny. However, you still have to sit in the tutorial sections watching him being a funny guy because there is attendance taken in tutorials. During the tutorial, the TA will give you some time to complete a few tutorial problems. He then copies the solution on the whiteboard from the answer key. End of tutorial. Sigh...
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is probably the best thing in this class. The overall grade can be quite high, even if your average is not really that good. Some studying might be needed to get a good grade, as well as some effort on the projects, but that's it really.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too high at all. The course requires three projects, a conceptual schema design, a relational schema design, and a functional schema design. These are all a breeze, well, maybe not the functional schema because there are no online resources to help you. These shouldn't take you more than a day or two each to complete. Midterm was terrifying, but the average was low so it wasn't too bad. Final was about the same as the midterm.

reviews.author: LinkedList
reviews.title: High Workload and content are very specific(difficult to find online resource)
reviews.comment_content:
It 's an advanced course for COMP3311.The Course Content is about the conceptual,logical,physical schema.The content maybe useful if you wanna being a database programmer in the future,

If not,you shouldn 't register this course as well as high workload,there have over 100 pages Notes need to read,and there are no resources help you online.For example,It 's quite difficult to find the practice problems and definition of cascading delete,trap,integration etc online.

And somethings are useless for your future such as distributed database .And I think if you are not being DBA in the future,you could better take other.Also,about 30% of content are blow water and wouldn 't need for your career.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecturer is good and taught notes clearly.But some of important points could be messed up because of the project 's deadline.

And I don 't know what the tutorial teacher doing even after the last lesson....
reviews.comment_grading:
Exam is quite difficult and no one get more than 80 in final.And questions are tricky,for example it deducted mark if you get wrong the answer.It 's quite easy to get the whole part wrong.

And you don 't know which topics could be exam .The most ridiculous is the logical schema taught over 4 sections however  only 1 MC could related. However,the Integration is the syllabus of mid term and it test many(Over 20%).

many high gpa student would choose this course.(maybe they have strong interest of db in COMP3311)
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is vvvv high.Including Mid term and FInal Exam.

3 reports content are very large and most of report required to write in descriptive form.And the conceptual schema are over 30 entities.You can imagine the workloads for doing logical schema is so much high,

Too much notes and things for memorize just like COMP3511.I think student got good grade in COMP3511 May have a good performance for this course.
